expected.trend_1880_2012_avg: head (map (fun x -> x.trend_1880_2012) (filter (fun x -> x.dataset == "Average") tableData))
expected.trend_1880_2012_AR5: head (map (fun x -> x.trend_1880_2012) (filter (fun x -> x.dataset == "NOAAGlobalTemp") tableData))
expected.trend_1880_2012_CW: head (map (fun x -> x.trend_1880_2012) (filter (fun x -> x.dataset == "Cowtan-Way") tableData))

paragraph.value: A further two datasets, Berkeley Earth (Rohde et al., 2013) and that of the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), are provided in Table 1.1. This working definition provides an updated estimate of [REPLACE id="trend_1880_2012_avg" value="0.86"]°C for the warming over the period 1880–2012 based on a linear trend. This quantity was quoted as [REPLACE id="trend_1880_2012_AR5" value="0.85"]°C in the AR5. Hence the inclusion of the Cowtan-Way dataset ([REPLACE id="trend_1880_2012_CW" value="0.88"]°C) does not introduce any inconsistency with the AR5.
